page.title: 03ECOLOGY,CLIMATE
page.content: A raingauge used to be installed at the Water Bailiff's house in Senny- bridge and continuous records of rain -fall exist from 1965 until the early nineteen eighties. Although the exposure of this site waa not part- icularly satisfactory, the average annual total rainfall of 1500 millimetres there is confirmed by the shorter run of overlapping records of rainfall kept at TREDUSTAN HALL, Defynnog, which is about 1 km distant. As elsewhere in this part of Britain the driest month is May or June and the wettest is November or December.
